website_summaries.verdict: A sophisticated shaving soap bowl that will add a touch of elegance to your shaving experience.
pros: Fits almost any brand of soap once melted down
cons: Not as well constructed as some of the others listed here

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, needs to be deeper.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this bowl so I would have two different bowls for shaving. One for soap and one for cream. I was going to use this for the soap but it isn't very deep. The bar of soap would fit inside the bowl but overflow when using my brush to lather up. It does great for a cream since you're not using a bar. You'll also want to leave this open for a day or two to air it out on receiving. It has a strong wood odor when you open the package. Not something I want mixing with my shaving cream/soap. It does look nice and handles the cream well. I just don't like using it for the soap.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. BosargeTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: he loved the first one so much and after extending his ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Father's Day. This is actually his second Kingsley shave soap bowl, he loved the first one so much and after extending his shave soap collection he needed another reservoir for his rotation. He buys beef tallow shave soap pucks that fit very nicely in the bowl and give him the ability to create a great lather for his shaves. Price is fantastic for a quality piece, would definitely recommend to any shave enthusiast on behalf of my husband.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Szymanski

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice bowl that has lasted for my style.
customer_reviews.text: I was unsure if this one would hold up since the reviews are pretty mixed; however, it saved me a bunch of money and a year later I have had no cracks in the wood and I soak the soap before use in this bowl.
customer_reviews.author: TheInexperiencedPro

customer_reviews.title: Looks good & works fine
customer_reviews.text: It's not the best inside the bowl. I was a little concerned with the wood becoming damp and splitting as a result. I had a can of indoor/outdoor polyurethane, so I shot a couple of thin coats on the interior and have had no problems. It looks good and works well for the intended use. I'd give it 5 stars except for the extra work required. BTW, I've read a couple of reviews recommending melting shaving soap in the microwave. I have done that and, for reasons unknown to me, it actually degrades the scent. I had a rather expensive AOS sandalwood-scented soap that was ruined after only 60 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Garrison

customer_reviews.title: A little shallow
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of this soap bowl on one side of my sink with thisrazor/brush stand on the other. They complement each other quite well. The only issue (temporary, lol) is that the lid does not sit all the way in place when used with a TOBS refill.You would not notice to look at it but a part of my brain finds it irksome on some level. Of course it could be that its a tradition to grind the dome down on a new soap refill, I'm still getting the hang of DE shaving so what I don't know could fill a book,but I'm pretty sure if this bowl was 1/8"-1/4" deeper it would have gotten 5 stars...
customer_reviews.author: James Michael Mcleod

customer_reviews.title: polishes beautifully, and looks classy
customer_reviews.text: When my pewter tankard that had lasted me as a shaving mug for fifty years finally wore a hole, I had to get something new. So, I bought one of these wooden bowls and a stainless steel bowl at about the same price. There's no comparison. The bowl wins. It's holding up well, polishes beautifully, and looks classy. I'm delighted.
customer_reviews.author: cutaxshorty

customer_reviews.title: Nice bowl
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy and well made. I do wish it was just a little bit bigger so I could lather once instead of lathering once for most of my face, and then having to lather just a little bit more for the last little bit.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.andMrs.MorenoTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of all the comments saying that it was big enough for pretty much any soap puck. I get it and bam, first thing - it's too tiny. I couldn't even cram the thing in there. And no, I don't want to have to melt down the soap to get it to fit. I just want a container that can hold the pucks. Also, the 'loose-fitting lid' does not make it perfect for travel. But 'loose-fitting' they mean that the lid is literally just sitting on top with nothing holding it on.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E.

customer_reviews.title: All is good
customer_reviews.text: I'm keeping the bowl as it's been paid for along with a five dollar prime gift. You check out what went down or please call me at: 708 606 4553 and the matter will be solved I've talked twice this week to your reps and all is paid for and I'm getting 2 more things this week that were paid 4. Please call if any question but I'm going to ask for a free month of bnb prime or a money gift that wont help much as I was CV on a free month gift trial and I've been a customer for many years.
customer_reviews.author: David Iserman

customer_reviews.title: Mango wood shave soap bowl
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it looked good and was not expensive. It does look good and holds my shave soap well. I have a very nice English boars hair brush which I wet with very hot water and work up a heavy foam. After shaving, I close the bowl, rise it o0ff, dry it, and put it away. The varnish coat has been thick enough to prevent any water damage. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Domenick V. Amato

customer_reviews.title: Much much much nicer in person
customer_reviews.text: This picture is god awful. The bowl itself is a nice, very dark, polished wood. I bought this simply because it was a cheap soap bowl, but if you're looking for something aesthetically pleasing, you will not be disappointed. Edit: I have revised my review from 5 to 3 stars. While the bowl looks great, it is more or less useless for actually lathering. It is possible to get a decent lather, but it spills everywhere as there is no depth to the bowl. Additionally, the bowl retains no heat. I'd suggest a simple coffee mug or ceramic bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Colicchio

customer_reviews.title: Easy Clean Up and Elegant Looks
customer_reviews.text: This bowl is real wood and works great. I just put in a little of my favorite tube shaving cream and a small amount of water, swirl the brush around and I've got a nice frothy mix. The best thing is the bowl cleans up with water very easily and I've been able to get rid of any spotting very easily with a wash cloth. I've used it about ten times so I can't speak to its longevity yet, but for the price I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bernstein

customer_reviews.title: Shave soap bowl
customer_reviews.text: I recently went back to an Old School style double edge razor and figured while i was at it i would convert to old school shave soap too. This item works and looks good holding my soap cake for shaving soap. It could also be used as a small jewelry box or as a box to hold small items on a desk. i think i will be ordering a few more of these in the future for uses listed previously and for future uses i can think of.
customer_reviews.author: T.A. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Looks Good
customer_reviews.text: Almost looks as good as the ones that some of my soaps came in (mahogany from DR Harris, Crabtree & Evelyn, etc). I needed something for my Col Conk soap. I tried the Parker one available on Amazon and really didn't care for the look and SMELL of it... very shiny coating and a bit large. This bowl looks much better, but it is a bit smaller so you may have trouble fitting larger soaps. I like to melt a small glycerin based soap into it using the microwave JUST until it starts to melt into it to fit right (+/- 30 seconds). Don't let it boil or you may burn the scent (or other components) out of your soap!
customer_reviews.author: Spartakiss

customer_reviews.title: Great bowl for hard soap refills.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know how I was going to use this at first. I thought I'd wasted my money. All the major shave soaps had their own container in which I could swirl my brush and get enough soap on to get several passes of a shave. Then I got the Mitchell's wool fat soap. Wow. That soap is great AND it fits perfectly into this bowl. It looks great on the shelf and can handle building up a lather with the soap. No cracks or other after related issues after 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: DWC

customer_reviews.title: A lot better than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: For storing hard soaps, this bowl is really nice. It doesn't give you a lot of extra room to maneuver the brush - it was smaller than I expected - but it works fantastically for large, short disc soaps (won't work well with Colonel Conk soaps). The small space means that you'll probably spill a lot of lather over the sides if you try to lather up in the bowl itself rather than using a second mug/bowl, but it cleans up easily and is a lot more water-resistant than I expected. Looks great, smells good - complements woody scents like sandalwood. Just remember to leave the top off for a bit after you shave, so the soap can dry.
customer_reviews.author: Duane Linton

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition aesthetically and functionally
customer_reviews.text: If anything it could be just a touch deeper BUT that's really quibbling. It's aesthetically pleasing and used to mix with the puck in it's original tin (Taconic Bay Rum) for loading, this produced a very nice meringue and was wide enough to get a good whip going. Quieter too when whipping back and forth than a ceramic or glass bowl, which is nice when like for me you may be shaving in the middle of the night when others are sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna

customer_reviews.title: Simple And Effective
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, holds the entirety of AoS's 5oz tub of shaving cream perfectly. Very simple design, no screw top, slightly less shiny than pictured but I have no complaints. A good product that I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Completely cracked through on one side!
customer_reviews.text: Bowl looks beautiful. However..... Cracked all the way down on one side of the bowl. The packaging was fine and showed no signs of abuse. So this Bowl was shipped with it already being cracked. Two of the six items I've ordered from Amazon have been defective in the last couple of weeks. My Merkur razor and this Kingsley bowl. In both cases the boxes and packaging have been excellent. So evidently damaged goods are being shipped.
customer_reviews.author: Plyply

customer_reviews.title: It's a bowl, for soap
customer_reviews.text: As far as function is concerned, this product is great. The bottom is flat with vertical sides. It is about 50% larger than it needs to be. This causes the soap puck to slide around a bit until it eventually adheres to the bowl. As far as form is concerned, this product is beautiful. The color of the wood and stain is wonderful. The exterior sides are contoured to make it look nice. It makes me wish that I had more counter space so it was out and visible instead of hidden on a shelf in the corner.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Howell

customer_reviews.title: Love the bowl
customer_reviews.text: Bought this fancy bowl to store my shaving soap. It looks manly. I great buy.
customer_reviews.author: D.W.R

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice wood bowl. Holds a decent amount of lather and having a lid is a bonus. I'm glad I purchased this one
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Attractive, Well Made
customer_reviews.text: I have bought three of these ,and very good looking containers..I have a label maker and under the lid i mark the name of the soap (eg. MWF, VDM, Omega). If milled soap grate into bowl, if hard made glycerin soaps melt into bowl. Everything looks neat, exclusive and vey easy to re-use. I will be buying again as I up my shaving soap stock. I am very pleased with these and there perfect..I hope this helps if you are reading this.
customer_reviews.author: RDW

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice deep color, pretty bowl overall. Certain soap bars were too tall for it initially
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It orks, but a bit too small for a standard soap cake
customer_reviews.text: A standard soap cake fills the cavity, leaving no room for the lather.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good Storage for extra soap
customer_reviews.text: My personal opinion, I don't believe that I would want to lather up in this bowl. Since it's made of wood, it will soon become water-logged and the shinny finish will disipate. I purchased this product to store unopened cakes of soap, especially since it comes with a lid. It is a very attractive piece to add to your shaving collection. For what I am using it for, it is well made and very much worth the price...................
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good little soap bowl.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for about three weeks know. Its a nice little soap bowl. Not really a whole lot else to say and if nothing else, it adds a little something to the bathroom decor. Looks like its good quality but we will just have to see how it holds up after time.
customer_reviews.author: phxn12

customer_reviews.title: Small wooden shaving bowl
customer_reviews.text: Didn't think this would last, but after a few months of daily use I have to say its a decent product from China.It holds a water bead and when I use a small amout of cream from my Taylor of old Bond st makes quite a lather.Its small, smaller that it looks in the picture, but for me and others having a narrow bathroom cabinet just fits nicely. Small unobtrusive , but does the job quite nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: You'd probably find better
customer_reviews.text: It's a wood looking sticker type thing unfortunately. And the lid doesn't snap on or anything. It has a small lip and sits there. If you tilt it 45 degrees the lid will fall off onto the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Nadia Dominique Malcolm

customer_reviews.title: Great bowl for soap storage
customer_reviews.text: Great little wooden bowl with a protective varnish on it to protect against water damage. It's deep enough to fit most refill shave soap pucks, but not deep enough to get a good lather going. I like it for the storage aspect, but use a deeper mug to create a good lather. I just find it easier to do it that way. For $8, it's a nice looking bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Tobin190

customer_reviews.title: Shallow
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated, this is a shallow bowl. My guess is, you could probably use it to whip a lather from cream soap in a tube, but a puck would definitely not be ideal due to the lack of depth. I realized this before purchasing. I use it to store my Astra double edge blades. It adds a unique look to my bathroom counter top.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan E. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking. A little shallow for my liking. I’m used to a glass cup! Great for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice bowl, but...
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, attractive wooden bowl. Here's the but: the lid was dull from rubbing the plastic packaging, and the lid would not close completely when a soap puck was inside. The puck used is a Vanilla Bean Shaving Cake shave soap by Kell's Original, 2.5" diameter. The dish is 3.25" diameter. I'm returning it to Amazon and looking for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Terry L

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I got the shipment confirmation yesterday and it was in my mailbox by today! Impressed with the fast shipping. It's a lot bigger than I thought after reading some of these reviews. I bought a badger brush, a soap puck, and this to make a little gift basket for my boyfriend. It'll be his first experience with wetshaving, so I hope it all works out
customer_reviews.author: K.J.

customer_reviews.title: Nice for travel. Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to travel with. It is much lighter than my ceramic one and has a cover that I keep in place with a rubber band, very simple. The wood looks good with no flaws.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Garner

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Decent soap bowl for the money. Ginish is a little rough.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size
customer_reviews.text: I usually face lather and this works very well for that purpose. I took some Col. Conk Lime soap and microwaved it for about 10 seconds and poured it into the bowl. It jelled in the bowl perfectly. It fits nicely in my hand when I load my brush. Although the lid is not air tight, I can see that it would travel easily. And, it looks nice on my shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Jayaruh

customer_reviews.title: Buy the marble shave bowl!
customer_reviews.text: Buy the marble, glass, or ceramic shave bowl. The protective finish on the wood came off after a few months. Now the wood is starting to look awful from the exposure to soap and water.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Nice shaving bowl
customer_reviews.text: I used to use a mug for my wet shaving, but the mug was too deep so it was hard to swirl my brush. I read good reviews on this bowl and noticed it was not too deep. I am glad I bought it because it makes lathering alot easier than with a mug. I don't use the lid at all, so thats not helpful for me, but overall it is a nice product.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made and a decent size
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made and a decent size. It’s not a finely crafted item to display by any means, but it gets the job done. Only complaint is that the side walls could be taller, some lather inevitable comes out the sides when you use it so there is an additional clean-up step when you are done.
customer_reviews.author: Tanu501

customer_reviews.title: Good Shaving Soap Bowl
customer_reviews.text: you're getting what you are paying for. perfectly functional. not the prettiest bowl I've ever seen. and it feels a little cheap. I use it for my backup. store it under my counter so i don't have to look at it. but works great. lid fits base well.
customer_reviews.author: casey pappa

customer_reviews.title: Feels cheap, terrible shipping
customer_reviews.text: Package as delivered quickly, but inside the box I found the plastic package was torn open and there is no lid for the dish. Dish itself looks serviceable but none too fancy.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Not a lighter wood like I had expected...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this particular shave soap bowl because from the picture it looks like the wood is a lighter and more diverse color of wood than the other listings for Kingsley shave soap bowls. This is not the case--it's exactly the same as the others. I was also hoping the lid would fit a little bit tighter than it does, but it's not terrible. I like this bowl, just not exactly what I had hoped for.
customer_reviews.author: jeech

customer_reviews.title: Nice bowl
customer_reviews.text: Along with the safety razor and soap you must buy a shave bowl. Overall this product is good and light. My only complain is that its a bit small. My soap doesn't quit fit in the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: S. Levantis

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4 years
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 4 years before all the varnish started to come off. Okay for your first shave bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Brayden

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice on bathroom counter
customer_reviews.text: Nice shaving bowl. Solid wood, nice finish. Pretty decent quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly mackay

customer_reviews.title: Design helps me to hold it
customer_reviews.text: Design helps me to hold it, I have RA. I've dropped 2 ceramic bowls. Only drawback is it's messier than bowls with sides. Wife likes the look since I leave it on the counter top.
customer_reviews.author: JBW

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking bowl.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my boyfriend (although I use it as well) and it's really nice. Not too much else to be said! Holds the soap, lid fits, and it looks nice. When it first arrived it did smell a bit like wood lacquer, but I don't notice it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa

customer_reviews.title: Seems like cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: Had to return due to flimsy quality. The top did not fit well on the bowl. Seems like cheap quality. Made in Taiwan...figures.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Brown

customer_reviews.title: Nice shaving soap holder that doesn't break the bank.
customer_reviews.text: VERY nicely finished. Knowing the amount of water this wooden bowl this will encounter, I sprayed the interior with a couple (or 3 or 4) coats of Polyurethane coating to lessen the effects of water. It has held up completely for the month or so I've used it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Golf

customer_reviews.title: Very nice! Solid
customer_reviews.text: Very nice! Solid, well made, looks nice. Is a little large but I suppose that was to accommodate the largest soaps available. I did coat the interior with another few layers of clear varnish but that was not because it wasn't done well. I just wanted to make sure the seal was good and the wood wouldn't succumb to water damage. Otherwise, its solid.
customer_reviews.author: WesY

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Shave Soap Bowl
customer_reviews.text: Very nice addition to my shaving gear. I love the lid because I remember as a kid seeing the soap in my Dad's shaving mug and how dirty it looked over time. The only thing that keeps me from giving it 5 stars is that it is slightly too small for my Art of Shaving soap puck, but it slipped in without much difficulty.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, maybe just a tad small.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality bowl for the price. The lacquer job on it is smooth and solid. I maybe would have preferred something a bit larger but that is my own fault.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Attractive
customer_reviews.text: This functions as well as you could ask and looks great on your counter. I've been using it for a few months and have encountered no flaws. It is a bit larger than a standard soap puck, but after a few uses the puck will stay in place and yield an enjoyable lathering experience. Easily worth twice what I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Howell

customer_reviews.title: Its Ok
customer_reviews.text: It is a really nice bowl and I like the way it feels in my hand, however it is very shallow. It conducts heat very well. I place it in a bowl of hot water to heat it up, it keeps heat well to give me a warm lather, but it is fairly shallow and shaving cream will flow over the side while working up a lather.
customer_reviews.author: John H

customer_reviews.title: Great bowl for shaving soap
customer_reviews.text: Excellent soap bowl made of real wood. Even though it is made of wood, water hasn't been able to mess up with it. Fits my badger soap easily with some room around it. Totally worth it. Build is nice and looks elegant too.
customer_reviews.author: KnightDavion

customer_reviews.title: I recommend going elsewhere for a decent shave bowl
customer_reviews.text: Bowl cracked within the first week of use. I used it maybe 3 times before there was a decent crack down the side. I recommend going elsewhere for a decent shave bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: noice!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for specificly for travel I've broken a couple ceramic bowels before I decided it was silly not to have a woolen one plus iyt has so much more class I'm curious to see how it fairs with water on a daily basis might need a bees wax coating
customer_reviews.author: waylon Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: A nice, smaller shave bowl
customer_reviews.text: I have no problems with this soap bowl. It is on the smaller side, but it holds what I consider to be an adequate amount of shave cream for an average-size face. It looks nice, and seems durable.
customer_reviews.author: Greg S.

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, not really necessary though.
customer_reviews.text: It's nice but you really don't need it. If you are using a badger brush you are better off putting your shaving cream directly on the bristles and working the lather up directly on your face. This is just another piece of the process that you have to clean out and dry out.
customer_reviews.author: BigD_911

customer_reviews.title: However this bowl looks great and gets the job done just fine
customer_reviews.text: Just a touch on the large side for me, I find it easier to get a lather with a smaller bowl. However this bowl looks great and gets the job done just fine, cleans easily.
customer_reviews.author: Norm

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this after the mug I received several years ago bit the dust such that super glue could not reconnect it. I was hesitant at first using wood in a wet environment, but it has fit well now into my travel case, and am enjoying it,, even though it does not have the butterfly and ladybug stickers the old mug had.
customer_reviews.author: Donya

customer_reviews.title: A touch of class
customer_reviews.text: Very nice soap holder for shaving. A touch of class. Tried two dif soap in it and both fit well. Been using about 2 months and its kept its finish nicely
customer_reviews.author: planedriver

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: This dish is exactly as advertised. A new disc of Col. Conk's soap slightly lifts the lid off, but it fits nicely after the first use. My only concern is if there might be a problem if water pools in the bottom, but this hasn't happened yet.
customer_reviews.author: T.A.S.

customer_reviews.title: Works okay
customer_reviews.text: Works, the finish is a little different from the top to bottom and the bottom has a bubble in the finish.
customer_reviews.author: J. Eddy

customer_reviews.title: A nice shave soap bowl for pucks
customer_reviews.text: A nice shave soap bowl for pucks, but is a little shallow and sometimes hard to contain the soap. The outside is nicely coated wood, but the inside is a rough wood without any polishing done on it.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Great bowl for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This a great shave soap bowl for the price. It will easily hold most shave soaps. It has a nice woody smell to it when you first get it, but after using for a while, I no longer notice the smell of the bowl. It could be a little bigger, but I chose this bowl because it looks very nice. Very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost completely satisfied...
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's supposed to do and it's an attractive color and overall design. I only wish this same bowl was available with a rounded bowl on the inside.
customer_reviews.author: J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: What can I say, it's a wood bowl with ...
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, it's a wood bowl with a lid...Only 4 stars because shaving soap gets a little stuck in the bottom edge. No big deal though.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo Stiglitz

customer_reviews.title: not too bad
customer_reviews.text: This bowl is great for some melt and pour soap but I would suggest sanding the finish out on the inside. as I got to the end of my first Col Conk glycerin soap that I melted and poured into this bowl the finish started to flake off and get into my lather.
customer_reviews.author: DKB827

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Container
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this container. He melted his shaving soap down in the microwave and poured it into the bowl to fit better. It looks beautiful on our sink and I love that it has a cover. He also purchased one for his friend.
customer_reviews.author: MacSalv

customer_reviews.title: When working up a lather it runs out onto counter But I like it for keeping my loose change
customer_reviews.text: This is to shallow for my soap.When working up a lather it runs out onto counter But I like it for keeping my loose change in
customer_reviews.author: P Baltes

customer_reviews.title: Finish is already coming off
customer_reviews.text: I've had this shave bowl for about 2 months now. I just noticed last night that the finish inside the bowl is starting to come off. I'll be replacing this with a metal or a ceramic bowl very shortly.
customer_reviews.author: Allen E.

customer_reviews.title: Good Bowl.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bowl for the price. Fits almost any brand of shave soap once you melt it down. I was able to do this by placing my soap bar into the bowl, and putting the bowl into the microwave for 30 seconds. It stands up, fits in my medicine cabinet, and is fairly water resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Caldarone

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband, he just started using this and loves it, it's beautiful and I love that you can put the lid on it and keep it clean! Love this!
customer_reviews.author: Janice Tancredi

customer_reviews.title: Does what it supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying several different shaving soaps, some of which don't come with a container. This works great and look good on the shelf for what that's worth. Hard to give this anything but 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Kehoe

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Meh. I like the natural wood bowl better in terms of appearance, but this'll do.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Natural

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: This shaving bowl looks and feels very nice. I was thinking that I would like it to be a bit bigger, but then it might be difficult to hold when wet. So, if you don't need a whole bunch of room to mix your suds, I would recommend this bowl.
customer_reviews.author: R. C.

customer_reviews.title: Rating for Kingsley Shave soap bowl
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit wider than I thought it would be but that's perfect. I also will mention some shave soaps I put inside don't allow the lid to fully close, but the soap should go down in a few uses and allow it to close properly. It is nice though =)
customer_reviews.author: Nora Chavarria

customer_reviews.title: Wooden bowl.  What else is their to know?
customer_reviews.text: I use this to lather up my shaving cream and am not using with soap. That said, it's a wooden bowl. If I were using it with soap, I'd have taken measurements to make sure the soap would fit first, so I'm not sure why people are knocking it for that.
customer_reviews.author: JG032

customer_reviews.title: It is well made and looks nice on my dark granite sink top
customer_reviews.text: It is well made and looks nice on my dark granite sink top. I am glad I purchased it. It fit nicely in the hand while working up a rich lather.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Pero

customer_reviews.title: The soap bowl is a nice dark wood
customer_reviews.text: The soap bowl is a nice dark wood. The Colonel Ichabod Conk almond shave soap I use is much smaller than the bowl and moves around. Probably not fair to blame the bowl, but that was why I gave four stars.
customer_reviews.author: John Laws

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: It's alright, not really sure what anyone could expect for this price but if you're gonna use this as your primary bowl just know the inside isn't waterproof or anything, you're a lot better off using a mug.
customer_reviews.author: cactus

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, performs well!
customer_reviews.text: Soap bowl works well, and exactly as it should. Great deal overall! No complaints and fast shipping! I need to get a better soap, but it's performed well thus far and goes well with the stand I bought on here too.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: Opps little too large
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful rich pattern wood, but the size was too large for my shaving bars. Needed something closer to 2 1/4. I'm sure I'll find a use for it, just not as intended. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: D. Singletary

customer_reviews.title: Intro to wet shave
customer_reviews.text: I got this as an intro kit to wet shave. It looks nice and was cheap. It matches the wooden stand I got. The lid doesn't really do much and the bowl is sort of small. Other than that, an excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Kang Wook Lee

customer_reviews.title: Looks Better in Person
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised by how nice this actually looks, and as far as I can tell, it performs its functions admirably. Note that not all soap pucks will fit it initially, but you can always solve that with a cheese grater.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this shave bowl. It works great and is very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Denise T

customer_reviews.title: The container is quite beautiful and fits nicely on bathroom counter
customer_reviews.text: a little dab provides a lot of soap. The container is quite beautiful and fits nicely on bathroom counter.
customer_reviews.author: tucson reader

customer_reviews.title: handsome bowl
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Rich colored wood. Nice water proof finish. Holds the soap. Lid fits well and keeps the dust off the soap. Very handsome next to a brush and straight razor.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Todd

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and weak.
customer_reviews.text: The bowl is nice. But it's made of cheap material. After having it for about a month there is a huge crack in the side. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Smelled kinda chemically. But I took a soft soap I had and hand molded it into the bowl. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: sahela finley

customer_reviews.title: It's a bowl! I use it with Taylor of ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a bowl! I use it with Taylor of old bond street shave cream to mix it in with a little very little warm water. I use use it to pre soak my brush in. It's not to big and I can travel with it. Overall it serves it's purpose and for $9 come on can't beat it!
customer_reviews.author: 1Pilot

customer_reviews.title: Nice Shaving Bowl
customer_reviews.text: High quality wood bowl. I did not realize how much I would miss not having a handle on the bowl though...
customer_reviews.author: Bobo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shaving companion!
customer_reviews.text: I love this shaving bowl! It is just the perfect size, and easily held in the hand while applying shaving cream with the shaving brush. The bowl and its cover are made of an attractive dark wood that does not crack. I recommend this bowl to anyone interested in using traditional shaving items for their personal care.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice little wooden bowl that shave soap fits in. I am able use my brush to lather the shave soap in the bowl. It was under 10 dollars. These are the exact things I was looking for- and this fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: J de North

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Great lathering dish for the price and it looks classy. It works well and as long as you rinse and dry it after each use, it should last a while.
customer_reviews.author: mudminnow180

customer_reviews.title: Nice bowl, good quality, manly yet attractive enough for the sink area in a lady's bathroom.
customer_reviews.text: Nice bowl, good quality, manly yet attractive enough for the sink area in a lady's bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Very pretty bowl
customer_reviews.text: I love that the bowl looks so nice on the counter. It holds the soap well. We bought Williams mug soap. It looks well made, not cheap. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: K. Green

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the Price
customer_reviews.text: It is a bowl you lather shaving cream in... not exactly a difficult task. It works well and it was cheap. I am docking it one star since the grains in the bottom of the bowl slightly collect build up from the cream but it rinses out fairly easy one you scrub it.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton

product_meta.title: Kingsley Shave Soap Bowl with Lid Dark Wood
product_meta.description: Shaving Bowl This Shaving Bowl is a stylish way to hold your shaving soap. Includes a loosing fitting lid that makes it perfect for travel.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
